p: The fatty acids of the omega-3 family (linolenic acid) and omega-6 (linoleic acid) are of great importance for the inflammatory process, since they are not synthesized by de novo synthesis and are precursors of polyunsaturated fatty acids, such as eicosapentaenoic, docosahexaenoic, and arachidonic ( 28, 29). Linoleic acid exhibited an important chemotactic role for macrophages, contributing to the autolytic debridement of the wound bed by increasing the production of metalloproteins inducing granulation and accelerating the healing process ( 13). In light of this, VOB also demonstrated great stimulatory effects on the proliferative and migratory activity of fibroblasts contributing, therefore, to granulation tissue formation and re-epithelialization of the skin.
